note.p: Education: Universities of Edinburgh and St Andrews

Career: Taught in a school in Dundee (1786); jointly started a flax spinning mill at Douglastown, near Forfar; studied mathematics in spare time; Professor of Mathematics, Royal Military College, at Marlow and later at Sandhurst (1804); retired on full pension (1819)
Medals/Prizes: Copley Medal 1814; Royal Medal 1826; Royal Medal 1839
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1842 No 55 pp 406-412
References: Alex D D Craik, 'James Ivory, FRS, mathematician: "the most unlucky person that ever existed"' in NR 2000 vol 54 pp 223-247
Alex D D Craik, 'James Ivory's last papers on the 'Figure of the Earth' (with biographical additions) in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 187-204
Notes: Precise birth date from DSB; index to BR provides year only.
